column4: I know autopackage is working on making software installation as easy as windows
I wonder if they will branch off into drivers in the far future
well at what point do you guys think that linux will be completely installable, configureable, and usable without the command line
maybe I should just go back to dos
being tied to a central repository fork-n socks
not true - you can compile on Ubuntu if you wish for example - besides which th erepos have > 17 000 packages...
learning the command line will set you free ;)
look at the O'Reilly website as a start I guess
O'Reilly publish "Linux in a Nutshell" for instance
